intro: Phlox alyssifolia subsp. vera, commonly known as the true narrowleaf phlox, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers in the summer. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
